page.title: 03Saint Mary's Church
page.content: Saint Mary's Church stands overlooking Ilkeston Market Place. It was originally built about 1150 A.D., and at this time it was quite a small building. This was then added to in 13th, 14th, 18th and 19th centuries, resulting in the present church building as it stands today. During its life, sections of the church have crumbled away, which meant that money has had to be collected and donated to restore it during the last two centuries. During its existence, the church has been under the control of three different Diocese. These were Lichfield, Southwell, and, lastly, Derby from 1927. The church has a tower which in it has a clock and eight bells. The church has an organ which is reputed to have been played by the Composer, Mendelssohn
